extendedLocation.description: The complex type of the extended location.

identity.description: managed identities for the Container App to interact with other Azure services without maintaining any secrets or credentials in code.

kind.description: Metadata used to render different experiences for resources of the same type; e.g. WorkflowApp is a kind of Microsoft.App/ContainerApps type. If supported, the resource provider must validate and persist this value.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

managedBy.description: The fully qualified resource ID of the resource that manages this resource. Indicates if this resource is managed by another Azure resource. If this is present, complete mode deployment will not delete the resource if it is removed from the template since it is managed by another resource.

extendedLocation.description: The complex type of the extended location.

identity.description: Managed identities needed by a container app job to interact with other Azure services to not maintain any secrets or credentials in code.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

The resource-specific properties for this resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

identity.description: Managed identities for the Managed Environment to interact with other Azure services without maintaining any secrets or credentials in code.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

identity.description: Managed identities needed by a session pool to interact with other Azure services to not maintain any secrets or credentials in code.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

properties.description: Container App session pool resource specific properties

allowedAudiences.description: The configuration settings of the allowed list of audiences from which to validate the JWT token.

groups.description: The list of the allowed groups.

identities.description: The list of the allowed identities.

enabled.description: false if the Apple provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

login.description: The configuration settings of the login flow.

registration.description: The configuration settings of the Apple registration.

clientId.description: The Client ID of the app used for login.

clientSecretSettingName.description: The app setting name that contains the client secret.

logAnalyticsConfiguration.description: Log Analytics configuration, must only be provided when destination is configured as 'log-analytics'

appId.description: The App ID of the app used for login.

appSecretSettingName.description: The app setting name that contains the app secret.

circuitBreakerPolicy.description: Policy that defines circuit breaker conditions

httpConnectionPool.description: Defines parameters for http connection pooling

httpRetryPolicy.description: Policy that defines http request retry conditions

tcpConnectionPool.description: Defines parameters for tcp connection pooling

tcpRetryPolicy.description: Policy that defines tcp request retry conditions

encryptionSettings.description: The configuration settings of the secrets references of encryption key and signing key for ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.

globalValidation.description: The configuration settings that determines the validation flow of users using  Service Authentication/Authorization.

httpSettings.description: The configuration settings of the HTTP requests for authentication and authorization requests made against ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.

identityProviders.description: The configuration settings of each of the identity providers used to configure ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.

login.description: The configuration settings of the login flow of users using ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.

platform.description: The configuration settings of the platform of ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.

enabled.description: true if the Authentication / Authorization feature is enabled for the current app; otherwise, false.

runtimeVersion.description:
The RuntimeVersion of the Authentication / Authorization feature in use for the current app.
The setting in this value can control the behavior of certain features in the Authentication / Authorization module.

enabled.description: false if the Azure Active Directory provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

isAutoProvisioned.description:
Gets a value indicating whether the Azure AD configuration was auto-provisioned using 1st party tooling.
This is an internal flag primarily intended to support the Azure Management Portal. Users should not
read or write to this property.

login.description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory login flow.

registration.description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory app registration.

validation.description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory token validation flow.

disableWWWAuthenticate.description: true if the www-authenticate provider should be omitted from the request; otherwise, false.

loginParameters.description:
Login parameters to send to the OpenID Connect authorization endpoint when
a user logs in. Each parameter must be in the form "key=value".

clientId.description:
The Client ID of this relying party application, known as the client_id.
This setting is required for enabling OpenID Connection authentication with Azure Active Directory or 
other 3rd party OpenID Connect providers.
More information on OpenID Connect: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html

clientSecretCertificateIssuer.description:
An alternative to the client secret thumbprint, that is the issuer of a certificate used for signing purposes. This property acts as
a replacement for the Client Secret Certificate Thumbprint. It is also optional.

clientSecretCertificateSubjectAlternativ.description:
An alternative to the client secret thumbprint, that is the subject alternative name of a certificate used for signing purposes. This property acts as
a replacement for the Client Secret Certificate Thumbprint. It is also optional.

clientSecretCertificateThumbprint.description:
An alternative to the client secret, that is the thumbprint of a certificate used for signing purposes. This property acts as
a replacement for the Client Secret. It is also optional.

clientSecretSettingName.description: The app setting name that contains the client secret of the relying party application.

openIdIssuer.description:
The OpenID Connect Issuer URI that represents the entity which issues access tokens for this application.
When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the directory tenant, e.g. `https://login.microsoftonline.com/v2.0/{tenant-guid}/`.
This URI is a case-sensitive identifier for the token issuer.
More information on OpenID Connect Discovery: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html

allowedAudiences.description: The list of audiences that can make successful authentication/authorization requests.

defaultAuthorizationPolicy.description: The configuration settings of the default authorization policy.

jwtClaimChecks.description: The configuration settings of the checks that should be made while validating the JWT Claims.

kind.description: Kind of auth github does for deploying the template

accountKey.description: Storage account key for azure file.

accountName.description: Storage account name for azure file.

enabled.description: false if the Azure Static Web Apps provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

registration.description: The configuration settings of the Azure Static Web Apps registration.

clientId.description: The Client ID of the app used for login.

blobContainerUri.description: The URI of the blob storage containing the tokens. Should not be used along with sasUrlSettingName.

clientId.description: The Client ID of a User-Assigned Managed Identity. Should not be used along with managedIdentityResourceId.

managedIdentityResourceId.description: The Resource ID of a User-Assigned Managed Identity. Should not be used along with clientId.

sasUrlSettingName.description: The name of the app secrets containing the SAS URL of the blob storage containing the tokens. Should not be used along with blobContainerUri.

baseOs.description: Base OS used to build and run the app.

environmentVariables.description: List of environment variables to be passed to the build, secrets should not be used in environment variable.

platform.description: Platform to be used to build and run the app.

platformVersion.description: Platform version to be used to build and run the app.

preBuildSteps.description: List of steps to perform before the build.

containerRegistries.description: List of mappings of container registries and the managed identity used to connect to it.

environmentId.description: Resource ID of the container apps environment that the builder is associated with.

destinationContainerRegistry.description: Container registry that the final image will be uploaded to.

identity.description: Resource ID of a managed identity to authenticate with Azure Key Vault, or System to use a system-assigned identity.

keyVaultUrl.description: URL pointing to the Azure Key Vault secret that holds the certificate.

certificateKeyVaultProperties.description: Properties for a certificate stored in a Key Vault.

certificateType.description: The type of the certificate. Allowed values are `ServerSSLCertificate` and `ImagePullTrustedCA`

consecutiveErrors.description: Number of consecutive errors before the circuit breaker opens

intervalInSeconds.description: The time interval, in seconds, between endpoint checks. This can result in opening the circuit breaker if the check fails as well as closing the circuit breaker if the check succeeds. Defaults to 10s.

maxEjectionPercent.description: Maximum percentage of hosts that will be ejected after failure threshold has been met

clientId.description: The Client ID of the app used for login.

clientSecretSettingName.description: The app setting name that contains the client secret.

activeRevisionsMode.description:
ActiveRevisionsMode controls how active revisions are handled for the Container app:
<list><item>Single: Only one revision can be active at a time. Traffic weights cannot be used. This is the default.</item><item>Multiple: Multiple revisions can be active, including optional traffic weights and labels.</item><item>Labels: Only revisions with labels are active. Traffic weights can be applied to labels.</item></list>

dapr.description: Dapr configuration for the Container App.

identitySettings.description: Optional settings for Managed Identities that are assigned to the Container App. If a Managed Identity is not specified here, default settings will be used.

maxInactiveRevisions.description: Optional. Max inactive revisions a Container App can have.

registries.description: Collection of private container registry credentials for containers used by the Container app

revisionTransitionThreshold.description: Optional. The percent of the total number of replicas that must be brought up before revision transition occurs. Defaults to 100 when none is given. Value must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100.

runtime.description: App runtime configuration for the Container App.

secrets.description: Collection of secrets used by a Container app

service.description: Container App to be a dev Container App Service

targetLabel.description: Required in labels revisions mode. Label to apply to newly created revision.

ignoreErrors.description: Boolean describing if the component errors are ignores

scopes.description: Names of container apps that can use this Dapr component

secrets.description: Collection of secrets used by a Dapr component

secretStoreComponent.description: Name of a Dapr component to retrieve component secrets from

serviceComponentBind.description: List of container app services that are bound to the Dapr component

customDomainConfiguration.description: Custom domain configuration for the environment

daprAIConnectionString.description: Application Insights connection string used by Dapr to export Service to Service communication telemetry

imageType.description: The type of the image. Set to CloudBuild to let the system manages the image, where user will not be able to update image through image field. Set to ContainerImage for user provided image.

probes.description: List of probes for the container.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Defaults to 3. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 10.

httpGet.description: HTTPGet specifies the http request to perform.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness probes are initiated. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 60.

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Default to 10 seconds. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 240.

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness and startup. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 10.

tcpSocket.description: TCPSocket specifies an action involving a TCP port. TCP hooks not yet supported.

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully upon probe failure. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod's terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). This is an alpha field and requires enabling ProbeTerminationGracePeriod feature gate. Maximum value is 3600 seconds (1 hour)

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Defaults to 1 second. Minimum value is 1. Maximum value is 240.

host.description: Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP. You probably want to set "Host" in httpHeaders instead.

httpHeaders.description: Custom headers to set in the request. HTTP allows repeated headers.

path.description: Path to access on the HTTP server.

port.description: Name or number of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.

scheme.description: Scheme to use for connecting to the host. Defaults to HTTP.

host.description: Optional: Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP.

port.description: Number or name of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.

configuration.description: Non versioned Container App configuration properties.

managedEnvironmentId.description: Deprecated. Resource ID of the Container App's environment.

workloadProfileName.description: Workload profile name to pin for container app execution.

patchingMode.description: Patching mode for the container app. Null or default in this field will be interpreted as Automatic by RP. Automatic mode will automatically apply available patches. Manual mode will require the user to manually apply patches. Disabled mode will stop patch detection and auto patching.

containerRegistryServer.description: Login server of the container registry.

identityResourceId.description: Resource ID of the managed identity.

image.description: Full name that the final image should be uploaded as, including both image name and tag.

server.description: Login server of the container registry that the final image should be uploaded to. Builder resource needs to have this container registry defined along with an identity to use to access it.

gpu.description: Required GPU in cores for GPU based app, e.g. 1.0

convention.description: The convention used when determining the session cookie's expiration.

timeToExpiration.description: The time after the request is made when the session cookie should expire.

allowCredentials.description: Specifies whether the resource allows credentials

allowedHeaders.description: Specifies the content for the access-control-allow-headers header

allowedMethods.description: Specifies the content for the access-control-allow-methods header

allowedOrigins.description: Specifies the content for the access-control-allow-origins header

exposeHeaders.description: Specifies the content for the access-control-expose-headers header

maxAge.description: Specifies the content for the access-control-max-age header

containers.description: List of container definitions for the sessions of the session pool.

registryCredentials.description: Private container registry credentials for containers used by the sessions of the session pool.

certificateId.description: Resource Id of the Certificate to be bound to this hostname. Must exist in the Managed Environment.

certificateKeyVaultProperties.description: Certificate stored in Azure Key Vault.

dnsSuffix.description: Dns suffix for the environment domain

enabled.description: false if the custom Open ID provider provider should not be enabled; otherwise, true.

login.description: The configuration settings of the login flow of the custom Open ID Connect provider.

registration.description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the custom Open ID Connect provider.

auth.description: Authentication secrets for the custom scale rule.

identity.description: The resource ID of a user-assigned managed identity that is assigned to the Container App, or 'system' for system-assigned identity.

metadata.description: Metadata properties to describe custom scale rule.

type.description:
Type of the custom scale rule
eg: azure-servicebus, redis etc.

appPort.description: Tells Dapr which port your application is listening on

appProtocol.description: Tells Dapr which protocol your application is using. Valid options are http and grpc. Default is http

enableApiLogging.description: Enables API logging for the Dapr sidecar

enabled.description: Boolean indicating if the Dapr side car is enabled

httpMaxRequestSize.description: Increasing max size of request body http and grpc servers parameter in MB to handle uploading of big files. Default is 4 MB.

httpReadBufferSize.description: Dapr max size of http header read buffer in KB to handle when sending multi-KB headers. Default is 65KB.

logLevel.description: Sets the log level for the Dapr sidecar. Allowed values are debug, info, warn, error. Default is info.

ignoreErrors.description: Boolean describing if the component errors are ignores

scopes.description: Names of container apps that can use this Dapr component

secrets.description: Collection of secrets used by a Dapr component

secretStoreComponent.description: Name of a Dapr component to retrieve component secrets from

serviceComponentBind.description: List of container app services that are bound to the Dapr component

consecutiveErrors.description: The number of consecutive errors before the circuit is opened.

intervalInSeconds.description: The optional interval in seconds after which the error count resets to 0. An interval of 0 will never reset. If not specified, the timeoutInSeconds value will be used.

timeoutInSeconds.description: The interval in seconds until a retry attempt is made after the circuit is opened.

circuitBreakerPolicy.description: The optional circuit breaker policy configuration

httpRetryPolicy.description: The optional HTTP retry policy configuration

initialDelayInMilliseconds.description: The optional initial delay in milliseconds before an operation is retried

maxIntervalInMilliseconds.description: The optional maximum time interval in milliseconds between retry attempts

maxRetries.description: The optional maximum number of retries

inboundPolicy.description: The optional inbound component resiliency policy configuration

outboundPolicy.description: The optional outbound component resiliency policy configuration

responseTimeoutInSeconds.description: The optional response timeout in seconds

serviceId.description: Resource id of the target service

secretRef.description: Name of the Dapr Component secret from which to pull the metadata property value.

maxAwaitDurationMs.description: Maximum duration in milliseconds to wait before a bulk message is sent to the app.

maxMessagesCount.description: Maximum number of messages to deliver in a bulk message.

scopes.description: Application scopes to restrict the subscription to specific apps.

match.description: The optional CEL expression used to match the event. If the match is not specified, then the route is considered the default. The rules are tested in the order specified, so they should be define from most-to-least specific. The default route should appear last in the list.

path.description: The path for events that match this rule

default.description: The default path to deliver events that do not match any of the rules.

rules.description: The list of Dapr PubSub Event Subscription Route Rules.

allowedApplications.description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory allowed applications.

allowedPrincipals.description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory allowed principals.

serviceBinds.description: List of .NET Components that are bound to the .NET component

serviceId.description: Resource id of the target service

cooldownPeriodInSeconds.description: The cooldown period of a session in seconds.

executionType.description: The execution type of the session pool.

containerAppAuthEncryptionSecretName.description: The secret name which is referenced for EncryptionKey.

containerAppAuthSigningSecretName.description: The secret name which is referenced for SigningKey.

secretRef.description: Name of the Container App secret from which to pull the environment variable value.

name.description: The name of the extended location.

type.description: The type of the extended location.

enabled.description: false if the Facebook provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

graphApiVersion.description: The version of the Facebook api to be used while logging in.

login.description: The configuration settings of the login flow.

registration.description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the Facebook provider.

convention.description: The convention used to determine the url of the request made.

customHostHeaderName.description: The name of the header containing the host of the request.

customProtoHeaderName.description: The name of the header containing the scheme of the request.

enabled.description: false if the GitHub provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

login.description: The configuration settings of the login flow.

registration.description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the GitHub provider.

buildEnvironmentVariables.description: List of environment variables to be passed to the build.

githubPersonalAccessToken.description: One time Github PAT to configure github environment

excludedPaths.description: The paths for which unauthenticated flow would not be redirected to the login page.

redirectToProvider.description:
The default authentication provider to use when multiple providers are configured.
This setting is only needed if multiple providers are configured and the unauthenticated client
action is set to "RedirectToLoginPage".

unauthenticatedClientAction.description: The action to take when an unauthenticated client attempts to access the app.

enabled.description: false if the Google provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

login.description: The configuration settings of the login flow.

registration.description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the Google provider.

validation.description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory token validation flow.

key.description: The key of otlp configuration header

value.description: The value of otlp configuration header

http1MaxPendingRequests.description: Maximum number of pending http1 requests allowed

http2MaxRequests.description: Maximum number of http2 requests allowed

fileName.description: Name of the file that the request should be saved to.

headers.description: List of headers to send with the request.

url.description: URL to make HTTP GET request against.

matches.description: Conditions that must be met for a request to be retried

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of times a request will retry

errors.description: Errors that can trigger a retry

headers.description: Headers that must be present for a request to be retried

httpStatusCodes.description: Additional http status codes that can trigger a retry

initialDelayInMilliseconds.description: Initial delay, in milliseconds, before retrying a request

maxIntervalInMilliseconds.description: Maximum interval, in milliseconds, between retries

action.description: Once route is matched, what is the desired action

prefixRewrite.description: Rewrite prefix, default is no rewrites

customDomains.description: Custom domain bindings for http Routes' hostnames.

rules.description: Routing Rules for http route resource.

caseSensitive.description: path case sensitive, default is true

pathSeparatedPrefix.description: match on all prefix's. Not exact

prefix.description: match on all prefix's. Not exact

routes.description: Routing configuration that will allow matches on specific paths/headers.

containerApp.description: Container App Name to route requests to

auth.description: Authentication secrets for the custom scale rule.

identity.description: The resource ID of a user-assigned managed identity that is assigned to the Container App, or 'system' for system-assigned identity.

metadata.description: Metadata properties to describe http scale rule.

forwardProxy.description: The configuration settings of a forward proxy used to make the requests.

requireHttps.description: false if the authentication/authorization responses not having the HTTPS scheme are permissible; otherwise, true.

routes.description: The configuration settings of the paths HTTP requests.

apiPrefix.description: The prefix that should precede all the authentication/authorization paths.

apple.description: The configuration settings of the Apple provider.

azureActiveDirectory.description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active directory provider.

azureStaticWebApps.description: The configuration settings of the Azure Static Web Apps provider.

customOpenIdConnectProviders.description:
The map of the name of the alias of each custom Open ID Connect provider to the
configuration settings of the custom Open ID Connect provider.

facebook.description: The configuration settings of the Facebook provider.

gitHub.description: The configuration settings of the GitHub provider.

google.description: The configuration settings of the Google provider.

twitter.description: The configuration settings of the Twitter provider.

identity.description: The resource ID of a user-assigned managed identity that is assigned to the Container App, or 'system' for system-assigned identity.

lifecycle.description: Use to select the lifecycle stages of a Container App during which the Managed Identity should be available.

additionalPortMappings.description: Settings to expose additional ports on container app

allowInsecure.description: Bool indicating if HTTP connections to is allowed. If set to false HTTP connections are automatically redirected to HTTPS connections

clientCertificateMode.description: Client certificate mode for mTLS authentication. Ignore indicates server drops client certificate on forwarding. Accept indicates server forwards client certificate but does not require a client certificate. Require indicates server requires a client certificate.

customDomains.description: custom domain bindings for Container Apps' hostnames.

exposedPort.description: Exposed Port in containers for TCP traffic from ingress

external.description: Bool indicating if app exposes an external http endpoint

ipSecurityRestrictions.description: Rules to restrict incoming IP address.

stickySessions.description: Sticky Sessions for Single Revision Mode

targetPort.description: Target Port in containers for traffic from ingress

targetPortHttpScheme.description: Whether an http app listens on http or https

exposedPort.description: Specifies the exposed port for the target port. If not specified, it defaults to target port

external.description: Specifies whether the app port is accessible outside of the environment

targetPort.description: Specifies the port user's container listens on

imageType.description: The type of the image. Set to CloudBuild to let the system manages the image, where user will not be able to update image through image field. Set to ContainerImage for user provided image.

action.description: Allow or Deny rules to determine for incoming IP. Note: Rules can only consist of ALL Allow or ALL Deny

description.description: Describe the IP restriction rule that is being sent to the container-app. This is an optional field.

ipAddressRange.description: CIDR notation to match incoming IP address

name.description: Name for the IP restriction rule.

configurations.description: List of Java Components configuration properties

serviceBinds.description: List of Java Components that are bound to the Java component

maxReplicas.description: Optional. Maximum number of Java component replicas

minReplicas.description: Optional. Minimum number of Java component replicas. Defaults to 1 if not set

serviceId.description: Resource id of the target service

eventTriggerConfig.description: Trigger configuration of an event driven job.

identitySettings.description: Optional settings for Managed Identities that are assigned to the Container App Job. If a Managed Identity is not specified here, default settings will be used.

manualTriggerConfig.description: Manual trigger configuration for a single execution job. Properties replicaCompletionCount and parallelism would be set to 1 by default

registries.description: Collection of private container registry credentials used by a Container apps job

replicaRetryLimit.description: Maximum number of retries before failing the job.

replicaTimeout.description: Maximum number of seconds a replica is allowed to run.

scheduleTriggerConfig.description: Cron formatted repeating trigger schedule ("* * * * *") for cronjobs. Properties completions and parallelism would be set to 1 by default

secrets.description: Collection of secrets used by a Container Apps Job

parallelism.description: Number of parallel replicas of a job that can run at a given time.

replicaCompletionCount.description: Minimum number of successful replica completions before overall job completion.

scale.description: Scaling configurations for event driven jobs.

parallelism.description: Number of parallel replicas of a job that can run at a given time.

replicaCompletionCount.description: Minimum number of successful replica completions before overall job completion.

cronExpression.description: Cron formatted repeating schedule ("* * * * *") of a Cron Job.

parallelism.description: Number of parallel replicas of a job that can run at a given time.

replicaCompletionCount.description: Minimum number of successful replica completions before overall job completion.

workloadProfileName.description: Workload profile name to pin for container apps job execution.

maxExecutions.description: Maximum number of job executions that are created for a trigger, default 100.

minExecutions.description: Minimum number of job executions that are created for a trigger, default 0

pollingInterval.description: Interval to check each event source in seconds. Defaults to 30s

auth.description: Authentication secrets for the scale rule.

identity.description: The resource ID of a user-assigned managed identity that is assigned to the job, or 'system' for system-assigned identity.

metadata.description: Metadata properties to describe the scale rule.

type.description:
Type of the scale rule
eg: azure-servicebus, redis etc.

containers.description: List of container definitions for the Container App.

initContainers.description: List of specialized containers that run before app containers.

volumes.description: List of volume definitions for the Container App.

allowedClientApplications.description: The list of the allowed client applications.

allowedGroups.description: The list of the allowed groups.

dynamicJsonColumns.description: Boolean indicating whether to parse json string log into dynamic json columns

allowedExternalRedirectUrls.description:
External URLs that can be redirected to as part of logging in or logging out of the app. Note that the query string part of the URL is ignored.
This is an advanced setting typically only needed by Windows Store application backends.
Note that URLs within the current domain are always implicitly allowed.

cookieExpiration.description: The configuration settings of the session cookie's expiration.

nonce.description: The configuration settings of the nonce used in the login flow.

preserveUrlFragmentsForLogins.description: true if the fragments from the request are preserved after the login request is made; otherwise, false.

routes.description: The routes that specify the endpoints used for login and logout requests.

tokenStore.description: The configuration settings of the token store.

logoutEndpoint.description: The endpoint at which a logout request should be made.

scopes.description: A list of the scopes that should be requested while authenticating.

domainControlValidation.description: Selected type of domain control validation for managed certificates.

appLogsConfiguration.description: Cluster configuration which enables the log daemon to export app logs to configured destination

availabilityZones.description: The list of availability zones to use for managed environment

customDomainConfiguration.description: Custom domain configuration for the environment

daprAIConnectionString.description: Application Insights connection string used by Dapr to export Service to Service communication telemetry

daprAIInstrumentationKey.description: Azure Monitor instrumentation key used by Dapr to export Service to Service communication telemetry

infrastructureResourceGroup.description: Name of the platform-managed resource group created for the Managed Environment to host infrastructure resources. If a subnet ID is provided, this resource group will be created in the same subscription as the subnet.

peerAuthentication.description: Peer authentication settings for the Managed Environment

peerTrafficConfiguration.description: Peer traffic settings for the Managed Environment

publicNetworkAccess.description: Property to allow or block all public traffic. Allowed Values: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'.

workloadProfiles.description: Workload profiles configured for the Managed Environment.

zoneRedundant.description: Whether or not this Managed Environment is zone-redundant.

mtls.description: Mutual TLS authentication settings for the Managed Environment

encryption.description: Peer traffic encryption settings for the Managed Environment

enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether the peer traffic encryption is enabled

identity.description: The resource ID of a user-assigned managed identity that is assigned to the Session Pool, or 'system' for system-assigned identity.

lifecycle.description: Use to select the lifecycle stages of a Session Pool during which the Managed Identity should be available.

type.description: Type of managed service identity (where both SystemAssigned and UserAssigned types are allowed).

userAssignedIdentities.description: The set of user assigned identities associated with the resource. The userAssignedIdentities dictionary keys will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}. The dictionary values can be empty objects ({}) in requests.

includeKeda.description: Boolean indicating if including keda metrics

enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether the mutual TLS authentication is enabled

nonceExpirationInterval.description: The time after the request is made when the nonce should expire.

validateNonce.description: false if the nonce should not be validated while completing the login flow; otherwise, true.

clientSecretSettingName.description: The app setting that contains the client secret for the custom Open ID Connect provider.

method.description: The method that should be used to authenticate the user.

authorizationEndpoint.description: The endpoint to be used to make an authorization request.

certificationUri.description: The endpoint that provides the keys necessary to validate the token.

issuer.description: The endpoint that issues the token.

tokenEndpoint.description: The endpoint to be used to request a token.

wellKnownOpenIdConfiguration.description: The endpoint that contains all the configuration endpoints for the provider.

nameClaimType.description: The name of the claim that contains the users name.

scopes.description: A list of the scopes that should be requested while authenticating.

clientCredential.description: The authentication credentials of the custom Open ID Connect provider.

clientId.description: The client id of the custom Open ID Connect provider.

openIdConnectConfiguration.description: The configuration settings of the endpoints used for the custom Open ID Connect provider.

insecure.description: Boolean indicating if otlp configuration is insecure

httpGet.description: Http get request to send before the build.

scripts.description: List of custom commands to run.

privateEndpoint.description: The resource of private end point.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.description: A collection of information about the state of the connection between service consumer and provider.

actionsRequired.description: A message indicating if changes on the service provider require any updates on the consumer.

description.description: The reason for approval/rejection of the connection.

status.description: Indicates whether the connection has been Approved/Rejected/Removed by the owner of the service.

accountName.description: Storage account name. required if using managed identity to authenticate

auth.description: Authentication secrets for the queue scale rule.

identity.description: The resource ID of a user-assigned managed identity that is assigned to the Container App, or 'system' for system-assigned identity.
A Managed Identity to use to authenticate with Azure Container Registry. For user-assigned identities, use the full user-assigned identity Resource ID. For system-assigned identities, use 'system'

passwordSecretRef.description: The name of the Secret that contains the registry login password

autoConfigureDataProtection.description: Auto configure the ASP.NET Core Data Protection feature

enableMetrics.description: Enable jmx core metrics for the java app

javaAgent.description: Diagnostic capabilities achieved by java agent

enabled.description: Enable java agent injection for the java app.

logging.description: Capabilities on the java logging scenario.

loggerSettings.description: Settings of the logger for the java app.

cooldownPeriod.description: Optional. KEDA Cooldown Period. Defaults to 300 seconds if not set.

maxReplicas.description: Optional. Maximum number of container replicas. Defaults to 10 if not set.

minReplicas.description: Optional. Minimum number of container replicas.

pollingInterval.description: Optional. KEDA Polling Interval. Defaults to 30 seconds if not set.

maxConcurrentSessions.description: The maximum count of sessions at the same time.

readySessionInstances.description: The minimum count of ready session instances.

secretRef.description: Name of the secret from which to pull the auth params.

triggerParameter.description: Trigger Parameter that uses the secret

scheduledEntries.description: List of maintenance schedules for a managed environment.

durationHours.description: Length of maintenance window range from 8 to 24 hours.

startHourUtc.description: Start hour after which managed environment maintenance can start from 0 to 23 hour.

weekDay.description: Day of the week when a managed environment can be patched.

identity.description: Resource ID of a managed identity to authenticate with Azure Key Vault, or System to use a system-assigned identity.

keyVaultUrl.description: Azure Key Vault URL pointing to the secret referenced by the container app.

path.description: Path to project secret to. If no path is provided, path defaults to name of secret listed in secretRef.

secretRef.description: Name of the Container App secret from which to pull the secret value.

clientType.description: Type of the client to be used to connect to the service

customizedKeys.description: Customized keys for customizing injected values to the app

serviceId.description: Resource id of the target service

targetPort.description: Target port in containers for traffic from ingress

containerType.description: The container type of the sessions.

customContainerTemplate.description: The custom container configuration if the containerType is CustomContainer.

dynamicPoolConfiguration.description: The pool configuration if the poolManagementType is dynamic.

environmentId.description: Resource ID of the session pool's environment.

managedIdentitySettings.description: Optional settings for a Managed Identity that is assigned to the Session pool.

poolManagementType.description: The pool management type of the session pool.

scaleConfiguration.description: The scale configuration of the session pool.

secrets.description: The secrets of the session pool.

sessionNetworkConfiguration.description: The network configuration of the sessions in the session pool.

identity.description: A Managed Identity to use to authenticate with Azure Container Registry. For user-assigned identities, use the full user-assigned identity Resource ID. For system-assigned identities, use 'system'

passwordSecretRef.description: The name of the secret that contains the registry login password

domain.description: The domain name for the user.

host.description: The host name or IP address of the SMB server.

shareName.description: The path to the SMB shared folder.

username.description: The user to log on to the SMB server.

branch.description: The branch which will trigger the auto deployment

githubActionConfiguration.description:
Container App Revision Template with all possible settings and the
defaults if user did not provide them. The defaults are populated
as they were at the creation time

repoUrl.description: The repo url which will be integrated to ContainerApp.

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of tcp connections allowed

maxConnectAttempts.description: Maximum number of attempts to connect to the tcp service

auth.description: Authentication secrets for the tcp scale rule.

identity.description: The resource ID of a user-assigned managed identity that is assigned to the Container App, or 'system' for system-assigned identity.

metadata.description: Metadata properties to describe tcp scale rule.

containers.description: List of container definitions for the Container App.

initContainers.description: List of specialized containers that run before app containers.

revisionSuffix.description: User friendly suffix that is appended to the revision name

scale.description: Scaling properties for the Container App.

serviceBinds.description: List of container app services bound to the app

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Optional duration in seconds the Container App Instance needs to terminate gracefully. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). If this value is nil, the default grace period will be used instead. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. Defaults to 30 seconds.

volumes.description: List of volume definitions for the Container App.

connectionTimeoutInSeconds.description: Timeout, in seconds, for a request to initiate a connection

responseTimeoutInSeconds.description: Timeout, in seconds, for a request to respond

azureBlobStorage.description: The configuration settings of the storage of the tokens if blob storage is used.

enabled.description: true to durably store platform-specific security tokens that are obtained during login flows; otherwise, false. The default is false.

tokenRefreshExtensionHours.description:
The number of hours after session token expiration that a session token can be used to
call the token refresh API. The default is 72 hours.

includeDapr.description: Boolean indicating if including dapr traces

label.description: Associates a traffic label with a revision

latestRevision.description: Indicates that the traffic weight belongs to a latest stable revision

weight.description: Traffic weight assigned to a revision

enabled.description: false if the Twitter provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

registration.description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the Twitter provider.

consumerKey.description:
The OAuth 1.0a consumer key of the Twitter application used for sign-in.
This setting is required for enabling Twitter Sign-In.
Twitter Sign-In documentation: https://dev.twitter.com/web/sign-in

consumerSecretSettingName.description:
The app setting name that contains the OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter
application used for sign-in.

dockerBridgeCidr.description: CIDR notation IP range assigned to the Docker bridge, network. Must not overlap with any other provided IP ranges.

infrastructureSubnetId.description: Resource ID of a subnet for infrastructure components. Must not overlap with any other provided IP ranges.

internal.description: Boolean indicating the environment only has an internal load balancer. These environments do not have a public static IP resource. They must provide infrastructureSubnetId if enabling this property

platformReservedCidr.description: IP range in CIDR notation that can be reserved for environment infrastructure IP addresses. Must not overlap with any other provided IP ranges.

platformReservedDnsIP.description: An IP address from the IP range defined by platformReservedCidr that will be reserved for the internal DNS server.

mountOptions.description: Mount options used while mounting the Azure file share or NFS Azure file share. Must be a comma-separated string.

secrets.description: List of secrets to be added in volume. If no secrets are provided, all secrets in collection will be added to volume.

storageName.description: Name of storage resource. No need to provide for EmptyDir and Secret.

storageType.description: Storage type for the volume. If not provided, use EmptyDir.

mountPath.description: Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted.Must not contain ':'.

subPath.description: Path within the volume from which the container's volume should be mounted. Defaults to "" (volume's root).

volumeName.description: This must match the Name of a Volume.

enableFips.description: Whether to use a FIPS-enabled OS. Supported only for dedicated workload profiles.

name.description: Workload profile type for the workloads to run on.

workloadProfileType.description: Workload profile type for the workloads to run on.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives
The geo-location where the resource lives

properties.description: Dapr Component Resiliency Policy resource specific properties
Dapr PubSub Event Subscription resource specific properties
The resource-specific properties for this resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives
